title: FCC chair proposes new rules for accidental space explosion risk
summary: FCC chair Jessica Rosenworcel proposed new rules May 29 to cover the risk of debris-generating accidental explosions in space.

title: GOP senator calls for boosting Space Force capabilities to counter China
summary: Sen. Roger Wicker argues that DoD must evolve its perception of the Space Force from an enabling service to one with ‘formidable offensive potential’

title: Ars Live: How profitable is Starlink? We dig into the details of satellite Internet.
summary: How has Starlink has gone from zero to profitability in five years?

title: Sea-based launch startup scores $2.5 million Pentagon contract
summary: The Spaceport Company received a contract from the Defense Innovation Unit to advance the development of a mobile, ocean-going launch platform

title: Our only mission at Venus may have just gone dark
summary: A jealous planet guards its secrets closely?

title: LEOcloud to send Space Edge datacenter to ISS
summary: SAN FRANCISCO – The Center for the Advancement of Science in Space, which manages the International Space Station National Laboratory, is offering LEOcloud an opportunity to demonstrate its Space Edge […]

title: Daily Telescope: See carbon dioxide sublimating on Mars
summary: An amazing photo from an aging spacecraft.

title: AST SpaceMobile stock surges 50% after Verizon partnership for satellite internet to phones
summary: Satellite-to-phones service provider AST SpaceMobile stock surged after announcing a partnership with Verizon on Wednesday, adding to the company’s recent deal with AT&T to provide remote coverage across the United States.

title: Verizon plots $100 million direct-to-smartphone satellite investment
summary: Verizon plans to invest $100 million in AST SpaceMobile after joining its cellular rival AT&T to partner with the direct-to-smartphone satellite operator.

title: Open Cosmos wins Greek government satellite contract
summary: European smallsat manufacturer Open Cosmos has won a contract to build a constellation of seven satellites for the Greek government.
